title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d . option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: The test.class is then put in the subpackage\subpackage directory.
EB: But it will be nice to have the same behavior as javac.
SR:
To reproduce:

1. Create a class file in a subpackage, for example, 'subpackage\Test.java'
2. Compile the class using the command 'ajc subpackage\Test.java'
3. Execute the java command and observe the Exception thrown
4. Fix the problem by running 'ajc -d .' command
